editorial_summary.overview: Internationally reputed local children's theatre with caf√©, toyzone, garden and a playground.

reviews.text:
Wonderful theatre, cafe and indoor play space.

My son and I attended #Can‚ÄôtSitStill production of ‚ÄúOh No George‚Äù and played in their indoor play space for an hour before hand whilst I drank a coffee from their beautiful cafe.

The staff are brilliant: kind, caring, patient and considerate.

The theatre is a great space to watch a performance.

The cafe does a great number of vegan and vegetarian options including mylks. Next time we‚Äôre there we‚Äôll have a full meal.

Can‚Äôt wait to come back. Thank you to everyone there for being so awesome

I just wanted to take the time out to express how much we enjoy our visits to your venue.

On general days that we attend shows we always have a wonderful experience in a great fun, lively and positive filled atmosphere.

But I also wanted to touch on the fact that you all as a team do a great job organising a fun filled family day every year and put lots of your individual time and efforts in making the Summer fun day a success.

Your team are friendly, welcoming and nice to be around.
I bring my two little ones every year as your venue is one of our favourites and we always enjoy spending time there.

Just wanted to say thank you and we appreciate your hard work.

‚ÄúThe performance of ‚ÄòOh no George‚Äô was outstanding. My two granddaughters were in fits of laughter from the moment it started. The two actors were both brilliant. The portrayal of George was an absolute joy in its attention to detail and the  comedy. I loved that the production was so interactive and inclusive. We have two profoundly deaf family members ( who did not attend but we are a very deaf aware family) and I was pleased tell them that the performance was so inclusive; this lmeant a lot to us. I loved that it was so visual and that sign supported English was used. We felt so involved as the audience. The fact that the children also joined in and  ‚Äòplayed‚Äô with the rubbish ( the silver sheet passed up and down the auditorium) and throwing the red balls at each other at the end thrilled my granddaughters (aged five and three). The performance was an absolute delight in every way. My husband and myself also enjoyed the performance (as much as the children I believe üòä) and we delighted in their joy. Thank you so much to everyone involved in this wonderful production.‚Äù

The moment my kids see the Polka sign their face lights up! This place is truly magical. We had my son's birthday there last year and Bruno and the team at the cafe were so lovely and joyful they were practically celebrating it with us. They thought of everything and just made sure I was able to relax and enjoy with the guests. Yesterday we saw Everywhere bear for a post birthday treat and and I realised how many times we have been and all the lovely memories we have made at Polka over the last 6 years with both my kids. Thank you to everyone at Polka for everything you do, it really means so much to us and we are so blessed to have you round the corner

A lovely theatre but staff can be a bit slow in the cafe and not always clued up to children's needs - I didnt see high chairs (they are probably about but it wasn't obvious).  Cannot rate less than 5vsrmtars though as it is indeed a gem of a place

address: 240 The Broadway, London SW19 1SB, United Kingdom
